author: BVM Sportsdesk
title: Ten Bobcats Honored on Women’s Soccer Academic All-MAC Team
text:
Ten Bobcats Honored on Women’s Soccer Academic All-MAC Team
Ohio University's women's soccer team celebrated the achievement of ten student-athletes being named to the 2024 Women's Soccer Academic All-MAC Team. A total of 140 athletes from the Mid-American Conference qualified, demonstrating exceptional performance in both academics and athletics. To earn this honor, athletes must maintain at least a 3.20 GPA and compete in at least half of their team's contests, excluding first-year students and transfers. The recognized Bobcats achieved impressive GPAs, with several maintaining a 4.00.By the Numbers
- 140 student-athletes from the MAC were named to the Academic All-MAC Team.
- 10
Ohio Bobcatsearned Academic All-MAC honors.
- Several students maintained a GPA of 4.00: Celeste Sloma and Maia Soulis.
While the recognition is commendable, it remains crucial to ensure ongoing academic and athletic support for these student-athletes as they balance demanding schedules.State of Play
- The Mid-American Conference continues to emphasize academic excellence alongside athletic performance.
- The Ohio women's soccer program showcases a strong commitment to student achievement, with several players excelling academically.
Looking ahead, Ohio's women’s soccer program aims to maintain and potentially expand its number of Academic All-MAC honorees, encouraging students to excel both on the field and in their studies.Bottom Line
Ohio University's women's soccer team's success reflects the importance of maintaining high academic standards among student-athletes, reinforcing the value of balancing sport and education for future endeavors.
